title: Coronation Street's Daniel cheats on Sinead as she dies alone in devastating trailer
text:

Sinead Tinker will die in devastating scenes next week's Coronation Street - and the trailer proves it will be unmissable telly.

Dying Sinead makes a horrifying discovery about Daniel Osbourne and kicks him out of the flat during their final Christmas meal.

Daniel runs into the arms of Bethany Platt and the pair look set to kiss while terrified Sinead dies alone and scared.

And she might not be the only popular that is being killed during an explosive week on the cobbles, as David Platt is caught up in a violent prison riot.

Corrie tweeted: "ON NEXT WEEK'S UNMISSABLE CORONATION STREET!! Sinead says a final farewell to her loved ones, Daniel seeks comfort and David finds himself caught up in a prison riot alongside rapist Josh..."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

The dramatic trailer begins with the Barlow family having a roast dinner with all the trimmings as they celebrate Bertie's first Christmas early.

But the celebrations are cut short when Sinead makes a shocking discovery about her husband.

Furious Sinead tells Daniel to leave, adding: "Don't come back," in heartbreaking scenes.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Daniel is inconsolable when Bethany approaches her co-worker on the street and tries to comfort him.

Back at home, Ken tells Sinead he will go after Daniel, but she doesn't want to see him.

Later on, Sinead is drenched in sweat and looks close to death while sitting alone in the flat.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Meanwhile, her husband is in the arms of Bethany, who has made it obvious she has a crush on Daniel.

"Don't be nice to me, I don't deserve it," claims Daniel.

Bethany insists he does and the pair look ready to kiss as they gaze into each other's eyes.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

While all that is going on in Weatherfield, David finds himself trying to avoid harm during a prison riot.

All the prisoners have got loose and are smashing up the cells and setting fires.

David is woken up suddenly when someone smashes a bench against a window - sending shards of glass flying everywhere.

While speaking to Shona on the phone, David confesses: "Things just went too far."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Corrie viewers can't wait for the episodes and took to Twitter to reveal their excitement.

One fan said: "This is gonna be brilliant, can't wait. This is why Corrie is the best"

"That was the best trailer of the year I guess," added another.

A third said: "This is going to be sooooo sad!"

"Oh ffs don’t make Daniel cheat on Sinead," said a worried fourth.

*Coronation Street airs Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays on ITV at 7.30pm and 8.30pm
description: David Platt's life is in danger during a violent prison riot and Sinead Tinker says a final farewell in next week's Coronation Street
